p: In Sicily, the genus Ferulago is represented by Ferulago nodosa (L.) Boiss. and Ferulago campestris (Besser) Grecescu, both belonging to the subgenus Galbanifera [ 2]. In particular, F. nodosa, the object of this contribution, highlights a Balkan-Tyrrhenian distribution, being present in Greece, Albania, and probably also in the Yugoslav Republic of North Macedonia, with a western population exists in Sicily.
